history.proof: intros H1 H2 H3 H4. apply Nat.div_mod_unique with (b:=p) (q1:=n1) (q2:=n2) (r1:=r1) (r2:=r2). - apply Nat.lt_succ_r. shelve. - apply Nat.lt_succ_r. shelve. - shelve.

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof, without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Sovle This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
r2: nat
n2: nat
r1: nat
n1: nat
p: nat

Goal:
p <> 0 -> n1 * p + r1 = n2 * p + r2 -> r1 < p -> r2 < p -> n1 = n2 /\ r1 = r2

Premises:
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat Arguments S _%nat_scope
Nat.div_mod_unique : forall b q1 q2 r1 r2 : nat, r1 < b -> r2 < b -> b * q1 + r1 = b * q2 + r2 -> q1 = q2 /\ r1 = r2
is_gcd_fun : forall p q r1 r2 : nat, is_gcd p q r1 -> is_gcd p q r2 -> r1 = r2
Fin.weak : forall p0 : nat, (Fin.t ?m -> Fin.t ?n) -> Fin.t (p0 + ?m) -> Fin.t (p0 + ?n) where ?m : [p : nat n1 : nat r1 : nat n2 : nat r2 : nat |- nat] ?n : [p : nat n1 : nat r1 : nat n2 : nat r2 : nat |- nat]
Nat.succ_inj : forall n1 n2 : nat, S n1 = S n2 -> n1 = n2
bezout_rel_prime_lt : forall p q : nat, 0 < p < q -> is_gcd p q 1 -> {a : nat & {b : nat | a * p + b * q = 1 + p * q /\ a <= q /\ b <= p}}
Nat.mul_cancel_r : forall n m p : nat, p <> 0 -> n * p = m * p < -> n = m
bezout_generalized_lt : forall p q : nat, 0 < p < q -> {a : nat & {b : nat & {g : nat & {l : nat & {u : nat & {v : nat | a * p + b * q = g + l /\ is_gcd p q g /\ is_lcm p q l /\ p = u * g /\ q = v * g /\ a <= v /\ b <= u}}}}}}
is_gcd_mult_lcm : forall p q g l : nat, g <> 0 -> is_gcd p q g -> g * l = p * q -> is_lcm p q l
mult_is_one : forall p q : nat, p * q = 1 -> p = 1 /\ q = 1
Nat.sqrt_iter_spec : forall k p q r : nat, q = p + p -> r <= q -> let s := Nat.sqrt_iter k p q r in s * s <= k + p * p + (q - r) < S s * S s
is_gcd_0 : forall p q : nat, is_gcd p q 0 -> p = 0 /\ q = 0
Nat.divide_mul_split : forall n m p : nat, n <> 0 -> Nat.divide n (m * p) -> exists q r : nat, n = q * r /\ Nat.divide q m /\ Nat.divide r p
is_lcm_plus : forall p q g l u : nat, p = u * g -> is_gcd p q g -> is_lcm p q l -> is_lcm p (q + p) (l + u * p)
is_lcm_moduplus : forall k p q g l u : nat, p = u * g -> is_gcd p q g -> is_lcm p q l -> is_lcm p (q + k * p) (l + k * u * p)
plus_reg_l : forall n m p : nat, p + n = p + m -> n = m
own_multiple : forall x p : nat, x = p * x -> x = 0 \/ p = 1
Nat.le_lt_add_lt : forall n m p q : nat, n <= m -> p + m < q + n -> p < q
Nat.add_le_lt_mono : forall n m p q : nat, n <= m -> p < q -> n + p < m + q
Nat.lt_le_add_lt : forall n m p q : nat, n < m -> p + m <= q + n -> p < q
bezout_sc : forall p q a b m : nat, a * p + b * q = 1 + m -> divides p m \/ divides q m -> is_gcd p q 1
Nat.Bezout = fun n m p : nat => exists a b : nat, a * n = p + b * m : nat -> nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments Nat.Bezout (_ _ _)%nat_scope
Nat.add_sub_eq_l : forall n m p : nat, m + p = n -> n - m = p
Nat.add_sub_eq_r : forall n m p : nat, m + p = n -> n - p = m
plus_minus : forall n m p : nat, n = m + p -> p = n - m
plus_lt_reg_l : forall n m p : nat, p + n < p + m -> n < m
Nat.log2_iter_spec : forall k p q r : nat, 2 ^ S p = q + S r -> r < 2 ^ p -> let s := Nat.log2_iter k p q r in 2 ^ s <= k + q < 2 ^ S s
is_gcd_rel_prime : forall p q g : nat, is_gcd p q g -> exists a b : nat, p = a * g /\ q = b * g /\ is_gcd a b 1
Nat.add_lt_cases : forall n m p q : nat, n + m < p + q -> n < p \/ m < q
is_gcd_lcm_mult : forall p q g l : nat, is_gcd p q g -> is_lcm p q l -> p * q = g * l
euclid : forall n d : nat, d <> 0 -> {q : nat & {r : nat | n = q * d + r /\ r < d}}
is_lcm = fun p q r : nat => divides p r /\ divides q r /\ (forall k : nat, divides p k -> divides q k -> divides r k) : nat -> nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments is_lcm (_ _ _)%nat_scope
is_gcd = fun p q r : nat => divides r p /\ divides r q /\ (forall k : nat, divides k p -> divides k q -> divides k r) : nat -> nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments is_gcd (_ _ _)%nat_scope
Nat.le_lt_trans : forall n m p : nat, n <= m -> m < p -> n < p
Nat.lt_le_trans : forall n m p : nat, n < m -> m <= p -> n < p
divides_mult_inv : forall k p q : nat, k <> 0 -> divides (k * p) (k * q) -> divides p q
Nat.add_sub_assoc : forall n m p : nat, p <= m -> n + (m - p) = n + m - p
divides = fun n k : nat => exists p : nat, k = p * n : nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments divides (_ _)%nat_scope
Nat.mul_eq_0_r : forall n m : nat, n * m = 0 -> n <> 0 -> m = 0
Nat.mul_eq_0_l : forall n m : nat, n * m = 0 -> m <> 0 -> n = 0
Nat.eq_mul_0_r : forall n m : nat, n * m = 0 -> n <> 0 -> m = 0

``` 
intros r2 n2 r1 n1 p H1 H2 H3 H4.
intros Hneq Hsum Hlt1 Hlt2.
apply Nat.div_mod_unique with (b:=p) (q1:=n1) (q2:=n2) (r1:=r1) (r2:=r2).
- exact Hlt1.
- exact Hlt2.
- exact H2.
Qed. 
```

original: intros r2 n2 r1 n1 p H1 H2 H3 H4. intros Hneq Hsum Hlt1 Hlt2. apply Nat.div_mod_unique with (b:=p) (q1:=n1) (q2:=n2) (r1:=r1) (r2:=r2). - apply Hlt1. - apply Hlt2. - apply H2.
